items.title: Shopper stampedes are a thing of the past, but Boxing Day sales are still a big driver of spending
items.summary: The Australian Retailers Association is predicting a 4 per cent rise in spending in the Boxing Day sales, despite tough economic conditions.

items.title: 2025 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race: Day one of the 80th edition of the blue water classic, as it happened
items.summary: Master Lock Comanche takes over from LawConnect late on day one of the Sydney to Hobart, as tough conditions take their toll on the fleet, forcing a number of retirements. Look back at the action in our blog.

items.title: Gold Coast exclusion zone displacing tourists will continue until Tuesday
items.summary: Holiday-makers spent Christmas night in temporary accommodation after a crane damaged in a Gold Coast storm caused authorities to evacuate several streets around Southport.

items.title: Boddington gold mine infrastructure damaged by bushfire
items.summary: The bushfire has burnt through more than 4,000 hectares.

items.title: Fishing facilities lacking despite high boat ownership in Karratha
items.summary: Female fishers say the lack of toilet facilities at Karratha boat ramps does not cater for the increasing number of women on the water.

items.title: Tim Wilson desires to one day lead the federal Liberal Party
items.summary: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

items.title: Revellers swarm Coogee Beach for Christmas Day celebrations after Bronte Beach off-limits
items.summary: As thousands of revellers spend Boxing Day recovering, Randwick City Council staff worked through the night to remove 20 tonnes of rubbish following a wild pop-up Christmas Day dance party.

items.title: Vladimir Putin critic and pro-war activist sentenced to six years in prison by Russian court

items.title: When can you get a refund or exchange under Australian law?

items.title: New virtual fencing laws could promise safer bushfire response by allowing farmers to move stock remotely
items.summary: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.

items.title: Why Australian Open organisers will be torn on offering Nick Kyrgios a wildcard berth
items.summary: Nick Kyrgios remains one of Australian tennis' biggest names, but, according to Mark Philippoussis, there are clear pros and cons to offering him a wildcard berth for the Australian Open.

items.title: Hoop dreams come true as first Indigenous basketball team heads to USA
items.summary: School attendance was just as important as a jump shot for the scouts picking a First Nations team to take part in a prestigious US basketball competition.

items.title: Cricket cartoons illustrate a match to rival the Ashes played by prisoners of war during WWII
items.summary: As Australia and England clash in The Ashes cricket series, Australian War Memorial historians have uncovered two diaries that recount a cricket series played behind barbed wire in prisoner of war camps.

items.title: Boxing Day Test more than just cricket for descendant of Australia's First XI Aboriginal team
items.summary: They travelled on horse and cart and were smuggled on a boat for three months to England, the story of the First XI Aboriginal cricket team is being remembered as a descendant presents the Boxing Day medal.

items.title: The best classical music and jazz stories of 2025
items.summary: From homegrown heroes to visiting legends, here are Australia's favourite classical music and jazz stories this year.

items.title: Entertainer Kamahl, now 91, reflects on life, career spanning 70 years

items.title: Women and girls coming to the crease in more numbers at regional Victorian cricket clubs
items.summary: More women of all ages are signing up to play cricket in regional Victoria.

items.title: Scientists on 'high alert' as bird flu threat looms over Australian Antarctic Territory
items.summary: Preparations are underway for the arrival of the deadly H5 strain of bird flu in the Australian Antarctic Territory, as scientists gather baseline population data so they can measure potential deaths among wildlife.

items.title: Shield and First Guardian raise the question, who pays when super funds collapse?
items.summary: Thousands of First Guardian investors were dealt another devastating blow when it was revealed just $1.6 million had been recovered from the almost $450 million invested in the collapsed fund. Who will end up paying investors back their lost retirement savings?

items.title: How to track Sydney to Hobart yacht race 2025 and other questions answered
items.summary: Black sails, a tiny cannon, no prize money — everything you need to know about the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, as the 80th edition takes place.

items.title: Gamba grass risks star attractions in NT's beloved Litchfield National Park
items.summary: Much-loved by locals and bringing in more than 250,000 visitors a year, Litchfield National Park has become one of the Northern Territory's star attractions. But it's under threat from a near-invisible invader.

items.title: From Spongebob to Orwell: Here's your guide to Boxing Day movies
items.summary: The soaring mercury has you craving the cool, dark sanctuary of the cinema. But what to see? The art-house awards-season hopeful? The psychological book adaptation? The one with the big snake?

items.title: The marathon mums competing in the Olympics and breaking records postpartum
items.summary: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

items.title: Police make emergency declaration after partial crane collapse on the Gold Coast on Christmas Day
items.summary: Storms hit south-east Queensland on Christmas Day afternoon, knocking out power to thousands of homes.

items.title: Multiple bushfires threaten homes north and south of Perth, triggering power outages
items.summary: Several bushfires burning north and south of Perth have caused major power blackouts, including the entire town of Margaret River.

items.title: 'Scandinavian sleep method' could help your bad sleep
items.summary: This arrangement allows couples to continue sleeping together while meeting each person's individual needs.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Australia leaves out a spinner in all-pace bowling attack for MCG Test
items.summary: With up to 10mm of grass on the MCG pitch, Australia has opted for a bold and historic option and left out offspinner Todd Murphy.

items.title: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enforce new powers under protest laws
items.summary: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

items.title: Nick Bolkus, long-time Labor senator and Hawke-Keating-era minister, dies aged 75
items.summary: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

items.title: Analogue camera technicians with decades of experience retiring amid boom in film photography
items.summary: As film photography surges in popularity among younger generations, technicians who repair analogue cameras are retiring, raising concerns it will become a dying art.

items.title: Australia's 'outback fashion capital' promotes healing through fashion
items.summary: Almost three years ago, a region in Western Australia's far north was devastated by once-in-a-century floods. Now fashion is stepping in, to heal scars and promote confidence.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant expected to remain category one system as it passes Cocos (Keeling) Islands
items.summary: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands off the West Australian coast.

items.title: Aged care centre confronts racism, improves staff retention with cultural celebrations
items.summary: In 2024 a nurse reported racist abuse from some residents and family members. A year later, instances of abuse have plummeted and staff say it is because of a new program promoting respect.

items.title: She readies for a 23rd Sydney to Hobart as the crew honours late owner Peter Rodgers
items.summary: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

items.title: Second-hand shopping is a sustainable alternative, but could it be fuelling consumption?
items.summary: The rising popularity of second-hand and vintage fashion has been viewed as an opportunity to reduce fast fashion consumption; however, Australia remains one of the world's highest waste producers.

items.title: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds
items.summary: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

items.title: How political divides are putting more pressure on Australian couples
items.summary: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

items.title: Rental Family offers connection in an increasingly polarised world
items.summary: Academy Award-winner Brendan Fraser speaks to ABC News about his new film and why human connection is the antidote to an increasingly polarised world.

items.title: Christmas quiz: How well do you know traditional Christmas carols?
items.summary: Do you know your Merry Gentlemen from you Three Kings? Your Dancers from your Prancers?

items.title: Even in the markets, it's beginning to look like Christmas
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Bomb-making list, firearms, extremist flags seized from Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers
items.summary: Police found a bomb-making shopping list when they searched the home of a man who allegedly posted on social media that he supported the gunmen behind the Bondi terror attack, a Perth court has heard.

items.title: Alice Springs veteran Geoffrey Shaw remembered as tireless advocate for Aboriginal rights
items.summary: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

items.title: England skipper Ben Stokes defends his team as Jofra Archer ruled out of Ashes
items.summary: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

items.title: Concerns over abortion, vasectomies, IVF, gender-affirming care access as Catholic organisation Calvary buys Hobart Private
items.summary: The operator of the Hobart Private Hospital has agreed to sell the facility to Catholic healthcare provider Calvary, leading to concerns about access to surgical abortions, vasectomies and some other legal procedures.

items.title: Low-income adults and children in jail denied lawyers over Christmas
items.summary: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.

items.title: NSW premier says tougher gun, protest laws bolster safety as reforms take effect after Bondi terror attack
items.summary: Premier Chris Minns says some of the tougher laws on guns and protests in the wake of the Bondi Beach attack will go into effect immediately after the NSW Parliament passed a package of changes in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

items.title: Bondi Beach gunmen's phone pinged near Philippine region known for Islamic extremism: police
items.summary: Mobile phone data suggests the Bondi Beach gunmen may have travelled near a region in the Philippines where Islamic State-aligned militants could still be operating, a police source has told the ABC.

items.title: WA Police charge man over alleged antisemitic comments on social media
items.summary: A WA man's eligibility to hold a gun license will be reviewed after police charged him with allegedly posting antisemitic comments on social media.

items.title: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail
items.summary: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

items.title: Young motorcyclist warns others after surviving high-speed crash
items.summary: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

items.title: Sewage leak prompts Broadwater swimming warning ahead of Christmas
items.summary: Swimmers and boaties are being warned to avoid part of the Gold Coast Broadwater at Biggera Waters after a sewage leak just days out from Christmas.

items.title: Sydney to Hobart yacht race not expecting repeat of last year's horrific conditions
items.summary: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is in for milder conditions this year than in 2024, when two people died on the first night of racing, although sailors have been warned to expect strong winds.
